result.execSummary:
The defendant Sam E. Nelson III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Sam E. Nelson III was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sam E. Nelson III is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Sam E. Nelson III was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes: With Full Huber. Stayed-Call Diversion 373-3880 M-F by 12/13/16 to Report by 2/21/17.  If not, Commitment to issue without Huber privileges and new criminal charges.

Defendant Sam E. Nelson in court with attorney Lane Fitzgerald.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Testimony taken, Exhibits 1 - 8 received. Court finds defendant not guilty of Count 1. Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2. Court orders sentence withheld, 1 year probation concurrent with probation currently being served, complete DVIP, 30 days RCJ jail diversion with full Huber, call by 12/13/16, report by 2/21/17, bond to be applied to costs, any remainder to be returned to poster, 0 days sentence credit.
